column2: Simple to use, blazing fast and thoroughly tested WebSocket client and server for Node.js

column5:
[fix] Ensure `_compress()` callback is always called (#1618)

Fixes #1617
[minor] Set the flag to detect invalid API usage only when needed

[minor] Throw an error on invalid usage

Throw an error if the same `server` option is used for multiple
WebSocket servers at the same time.

[feature] Add utility to wrap a `WebSocket` in a `Duplex` stream (#1589)

Fixes #113

Revert "[minor] Remove unneeded `if` statement"

This reverts commit 297f56df79f6bf4757465fb6b59884faf5b75337.
[test] Use the correct value for the Content-Length header
[fix] Allow to disable sending the SNI extension (#1587)
[doc] Add missing dependency in code snippet (#1581)
[test] Do not use the deprecated `outgoingMessage._headers` property
[minor] Use `crypto.randomFillSync()` to generate the masking key
[minor] Use object spread syntax instead of `Object.assign()`
[major] Drop support for `url.Url` in the `WebSocket` constructor

[major] Change `WebSocket#{p{i,o}ng,send}()` behavior (#1532)

- If the `readyState` attribute is `CONNECTING`, throw an exception.
- If the `readyState` attribute is `CLOSING` or `CLOSED`
  - Increase the `bufferedAmount` attribute by the length of the `data`
    argument in bytes.
  - If specified, call the `callback` function with an error.

Fixes #1515
[pkg] Use caret ranges for all dependencies

[pkg] Move Greenkeeper configuration to package.json

Fixes #1550
[doc] Update HTTPS example, remove new createServer (#1548)
[minor] Add missing option in JSDoc comment

[fix] Make `WebSocket#close()` set the close timer immediately

If there is buffered data to write and the stream is not flowing, it
is possible that the callback of `Sender.prototype.close()` is never
called.

[minor] Remove unneeded `if` statement

The `'error'` event can be emitted after the `'close'` event only if
`socket.write()` is called on a closed socket. If this happens, it's
a bug.

Revert "[ci] Cache dependencies"

This reverts commit 9a89e5d5164415021db86da665d3b691321656c7.
[test] Remove comment to disable eslint rule

[minor] Remove length threshold

Do not use a length threshold to determine whether or not to copy data.

[minor] Buffer writes if the frame to send is made of multiple chunks

This allows to write all chunks at the same time via
`Socket.prototype._writev()`.

[test] Remove useless test

It should have been removed in 8ead18d0.

[feature] Add ability to follow redirects (#1490)

Fixes #812
[minor] Move all buffer conversion functions to the buffer-util module
[ci] Let Travis CI handle x64 Windows tests
[fix] Abort the handshake if the Sec-WebSocket-Key header is invalid
[codestyle] Use single quotes in YAML files

[fix] Use the `defaultPort` option (#1510)

Prevent the default port from being added to the `Host` header when no
`Agent` is used.

Fixes #1505
[fix] Handle close frame which spans multiple packets (#1494)

[minor] Set the handshake timeout via the `timeout` option

Set the handshake timeout when a socket is assigned to the request.

[pkg] Update list of published files

Refs: https://github.com/npm/npm-packlist/pull/14

[minor] Ignore callbacks when clearing the send queue (#1471)

Do not invoke callbacks when clearing the send queue due to premature
socket closure.

Refs: https://github.com/websockets/ws/pull/1464#issuecomment-435578571
Fixes #1226
[doc] Suggest implementation of heartbeat on the client (#1469)
[fix] Do not waste time compressing when socket is closed (#1464)
[minor] Do not use the legacy URL API
[benchmark] Add Unix domain sockets to bench (#1456)

[fix] Fix use after invalidation bug

Fixes #1418
[minor] Remove no longer needed workaround for `socketPath` option
[major] Drop support for the `memLevel` and `level` options
[major] Make bundlers use a browser shim that throws an error (#1345)
[fix] Remove the `'data'` listener when the receiver emits an error
[fix] Do not prematurely remove the listener of the `'data'` event

[feature] Add `headers` argument to `verifyClient()` callback (#1379)

Add ability to specify custom headers when rejecting the handshake.
[doc] Add `request` to emit arguments in shared server example (#1372)

[minor] Replace bound function with arrow function

Do not mask potential issues, like #1280, with bound arguments.
[doc] Improve FAQ example for X-Forwarded-For header (#1360)

[doc] Improve docs and examples (#1355)

Fixes #1334
Fixes #1338

[fix] Add default value for `servername` option (#1347)

Fixes #1346
[perf] Use js version of `{un,}mask()` for very small frames (#1348)
[doc] Explain the behavior of `server.close()` more precisely (#1342)

[feature] Allow all options accepted by `http{,s}.request()` (#1332)

Do not use an agent by default and add ability to use all options
allowed in `http.request()` and `https.request()`.

[fix] Allow URL instances as URL in WebSocket constructor (#1329)

Fixes #1143

[fix] Remove buffer `noAssert` argument (#1324)

The `noAssert` argument is not supported in Node.js 10.x.

Refs: https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/18395

[fix] Rename the `'close'` event to `'conclude'`

Avoid collisions with the `stream.Writable` `'close'` event.

[major] Fix subprotocol handling (#1312)

Do not close the connection if the server does not agree to any of
the client's requested subprotocols.

Fixes #1296

[minor] Add `zlib{Deflate,Inflate}Options` options (#1306)

Useful to adjust other options, and rather than support and document
every single one, it is simpler to allow passing on an object
wholesale.

The `level` and `memLevel` options are still supported but should be
removed in 5.x.
[fix] Ensure that the status code is not incorrectly overwritten

[doc] Add a link to isomorphic-ws (#1298)

`isomorphic-ws` is a tiny wrapper around `ws` (peer dependency) which
returns `global.WebSocket` on the browser.
[fix] Emit the first error that occurred, not the last
[fix] Ensure that the `'error'` event is emitted at most once

[minor] Discard any data received after the close frame

Remove the `'data'` listener when the close frame is received.

[minor] Clean up and rename `Receiver#readBuffer()`

Rename `Receiver.prototype.readBuffer()` to `consume` and merge
`Receiver.prototype.hasBufferedBytes()` into it.
[benchmark] Take into account both the incoming and outgoing data

[test] Replace no longer valid test with a new one

When an error occurs data can no longer be added to the parser as the
socket is destroyed.

[major] Remove `WebSocket#pause()` and `WebSocket#resume()`

This is in preparation for read backpressure handling when
permessage-deflate is enabled. The user should not interfere by
pausing/resuming the underlying `net.Socket` stream.

[fix] Fix `extentions` property type

Make `extensions` a getter that returns the negotiated extensions
names.

Fixes #1244

[major] Make `WebSocket#p{i,o}ng()` accept an optional callback

Fixes #599

[fix] Pass an `ErrorEvent` to the `onerror` event handler

Fixes #1173

[major] Remove ErrorCodes module

Move the `isValidErrorCode` function to the Validation module and
rename it to `isValidStatusCode`.
[major] Improve error messages and use specific error types

[fix] Use 1005 status code if close frame payload length is 0

Fixes #1257
[minor] Send the close status code only when necessary
[fix] Use status code from close frame if received
[doc] Fix rendering of history in SECURITY.md (#1250)

[minor] Do not set `allowHalfOpen` to `false`

Use the default value when the HTTP server is created internally.
[test] Skip `family` test if localhost doesn't resolve to ::1 (#1246)
[fix] Close cleanly only if a close frame has been sent and received

[minor] Refactor `WebSocket#finalize()`

Clear the close timer only when it could be set.
[doc] Add direct links to the Autobahn test suite reports
[test] Use an OS-assigned arbitrary unused port

[minor] Parse the Sec-WebSocket-Extensions header only when necessary

Avoid parsing the `Sec-WebSocket-Extensions` header if the only
supported extension, `permessage-deflate`, is disabled.

[fix] Rewrite the parser of the Sec-WebSocket-Extensions header

Make the parser correctly handle quoted values and close the connection
if the `Sec-WebSocket-Extensions` header is invalid.

Fixes #1235

[security] Fix DoS vulnerability

Ignore extension and parameter names that are property names of
`Object.prototype` when parsing the `Sec-WebSocket-Extensions` header.
[test] Skip `family` option test if IPv6 is not supported

[ci] Do not test on node 4.1.0, use 4.2.0 instead

All versions in the range >=4.0.0 <4.2.0 are bugged.

[minor] Refactor `PerMessageDeflate#_decompress()`

If context takeover is enabled there is no reason to remove and add
the listeners of the `'data'` and `'error'` events every time
`PerMessageDeflate#_decompress()` is used.

[minor] Remove unreachable code (#1224)

`zlib.DeflateRaw` emits an `'error'` event only when an attempt to use
it is made after it has already been closed and this cannot happen in
our case.
[test] Fix issue that prevented process from exiting
[ci] Remove no longer needed `dist` key from .travis.yml

[feature] Allow 'level' option (#1199)

This corresponds to the zlib level as described
in https://nodejs.org/api/zlib.html#zlib_class_options
[feature] Allow client to specify handshake request timeout (#1177)
[fix] Set wasClean to true when close code is in 3000-4999 range (#1146)

[major] Have permessage-deflate disabled by default (#1107)

This commit disables permessage-deflate by default on the server.

[major] Remove the `upgradeReq` property (#1104)

The `http.IncomingMessage` object, instead of being attached to the
`WebSocket` object, is passes as the second argument to the
`connection` event.

[major] Remove the `flags` argument (#1101)

The `flags` object specifies whether the received data is binary or not
and whether it was masked or not. This object is actually redundant and
therefore removed in this commit as the spec requires client-sent
frames to be masked and server-sent frame to be unmasked.

The `typeof` operator can be used to check whether the received data is
binary or not.

[feature] Allow path to be specified with UNIX domain sockets

This change allows URL path with params to be specified with
UNIX domain socket URLs.

An example URL with UNIX domain socket looks like:
  ws+unix:///absolule/path/to/uds_socket:/pathname?query_params

Note that ':' is the seprator between socket path and URL path.

Existing URLs like the following also work:
  ws+unix:///absolule/path/to/uds_socket

In the above case, path gets set to '/'.
[perf] Enqueue send operations only when strictly necessary
[perf] Write to the socket as soon as possible

[fix] Fix parser crash on synchronous socket error

This commit fixes an issue that could happen when the parser was
processing data and an error was emitted synchronously on the socket,
for example when writing to a socket whose connection had been
abruptly closed (ECONNRESET).
In these cases the parser was cleaned up prematurely and crashed when
trying to use resources no longer available.

[minor] Remove unnecessary `if` statement

Optimize for the most, hopefully, common case (no error).

[fix] Prevent the parser from triggering a stack overflow (#992)

This makes the parser work with buffers containing thousands of frames.

lib/WebSocket.js: expose binaryType property

The W3C WebSocket interface includes a binaryType attributes for a
socket and a corresponding BinaryType { 'blob', 'arraybuffer' } enum.
This enables support for the 'arraybuffer' BinaryType, but avoiding
changing the existing behaviour the default binaryType is set as
'nodebuffer'. The 'blob' type is left unsupported.

This improves ws compatibility with some existing W3C WebSocket based
client code.

Fixes: #441

Merge pull request #645 from Dignifiedquire/buffer-length

fix: shrinkStrategy should always return an integer

fix: shrinkStrategy should always return an integer

`Buffer` inherits from `Uint8Arry` so the constructor needs to be
called with integers and mustn't be called with floats.

This patch ensures that the result of the the calculation
in the `shrinkStrategy` in `Receiver` returns an integer.

The reason why this has not been a problem up to now is that
a there is a [V8 Bug](https://code.google.com/p/v8/issues/detail?id=4552)
that the [spec](http://tc39.github.io/ecma262/#sec-typedarray-length)
is not adhered in this case.

This is a blocking issue for [Karma](https://github.com/karma-runner/karma/issues/1768)
as the upgrade to [core-js@2.0.0](https://github.com/zloirock/core-js)
now enforces this error.

Merge pull request #355 from felixrabe/patch-1

Semicolon

Plug WebSocket.terminate timeout leak

If a caller tracks server connections (`WebSocket`s) on their own and cleans them up manually right before calling `WebSocketServer.close`, the calls to `terminate` (one from the caller closing the connection manually, and one from the server loop doing it) can happen so quickly that the internal state is `WebSocket.CLOSING` in both calls.  

This means that the second call will over-write the first call's `this._closeTimer`.  That means a timer gets leaked, and holds the program open for 30s.  Not a huge problem, but a confounding one.

This one-liner will prevent that.  The "right" answer is probably to update the state machine, but as far as I can tell, this timeout is the only collateral in this scenario, so the one-liner should be sufficient in practice.

Merge pull request #271 from davedoesdev/master

When unexpected response sent by server, make the request and response available

Merge branch 'master' of github.com:davedoesdev/ws

Conflicts:
	lib/WebSocket.js

New event, for unexpected response ('unexpected-response').
If there's a handler, it's expected to take care of reading and closing it.
Otherwise, the request/response is closed and 'error' is emitted.

When unexpected response sent by server, make the request and response available.
Fixes these problems:
(a) The request and response hang around (preventing process exit) until timeout
    - call err.request.abort to stop this
(b) It's very useful to be able to read the response! There may be extra error
    information returned by the server that can't be represented by the status
    code alone (e.g. some JSON data describing the error).

Add subprotocol support. #29, #192, #193.

- The client will set ws.protocol based on the subprotocol returned by
  the server. Fixes #192.
- The server application can select from multiple client subprotocol
  options by specifying a handleProtocols in initialization options.
  This function takes two arguments; the first is an array of
  subprotocols sent by the client (empty array if no subprotocol
  specified by the client), the second is a callback function. The
  callback function takes two arguments; the first indicates if the
  client subprotocols are valid, the second argument (only passed when
  first is true) is the subprotocol string selected to return to the
  client. Fixes #29. Fixes #193.
- The default subprotocol behavior of the server is to select/return
  the first subprotocol in the list.
- Includes 6 tests to test subprotocol support:
    - test default behavior of selecting first subprotocol
    - test custom handleProtocols that selects a subprotocol
    - detect server sending invalid subprotocol
    - detect server sent no subprotocol even though client sent
      subprotocol header.
    - test custom handleProtocols that rejects connection based on
      invalid client subprotocol request.
    - server responds with 501 to client if the handleProtocols
      handler neither selects a protocol nor rejects the connection.

Merge pull request #126 from kanaka/master

Allow application selection of subprotocol value

Add server sub-protocol handler option.

If the handleProtocols attribute is set in the options for
WebSocketServer then this function will be called to select
a subprotocol otherwise the first subprotocol sent by the client will
be returned.

The handleProtocols function takes two arguments: a list of subprotocol
strings and a callback. The callback takes two arguments: the result
and the selected subprotocol. The handleProtocols handler routine
should select a subprotocol from the subprotocols first argument based
on whatever criteria the application uses and call the callback with
first argument set to true and the selected subprotocol string as the
second argument. If the application determines that the client
subprotocol list does not have a valid subprotocol then it should call
the callback with a false first argument. This will cause the
handshake to fail with a 404 (not found) error.
